headline: A Look At Riot Platforms (RIOT) Valuation As Activist Pressure Meets New AMD AI Data Center Deal
summary: Riot Platforms (RIOT) is in the spotlight after activist investor Starboard Value pushed for a faster pivot from Bitcoin mining to AI and high performance computing, as Riot advances a long term Texas data center lease with AMD. See our latest analysis for Riot Platforms. Riot’s latest share price of US$15.65 comes after a 1 year total shareholder return of 56.66% and a 3 year total shareholder return of about 2.6x. Its 30 day share price return of a 9.43% decline contrasts with a 10.52% gain...

headline: Nvidia results are AI market's biggest test amid competitive worries
summary: As Nvidia heads into quarterly earnings on Wednesday, AI investors are seeking evidence that the chipmaker's profits are growing apace on the back of a $630 billion capital spending budget from Big Tech.  After powering much of the U.S. stock market rally for the past three years, Nvidia's stock has risen ‌just about 2% so far in 2026.  Google is also in talks to supply Meta - a large Nvidia customer, according to media reports.

content.title: Nvidia results are AI market's biggest test amid competitive worries
content.summary: As Nvidia heads into quarterly earnings on Wednesday, AI investors are seeking evidence that the chipmaker's profits are growing apace on the back of a $630 billion capital spending budget from Big Tech.  After powering much of the U.S. stock market rally for the past three years, Nvidia's stock has risen ‌just about 2% so far in 2026.  Google is also in talks to supply Meta - a large Nvidia customer, according to media reports.

headline: Starboard Pressure Puts Riot Platforms AI Pivot In Investor Focus

These developments point to a potential reset of Riot's business mix and could influence how investors view NasdaqCM:RIOT within both crypto and AI related themes. Riot...

headline: AMD clinches second mega chip supply deal, this time with Meta
summary: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase ‌as much as 10% of the chip firm.  AMD shares rose more than 11% in premarket trading after closing at $196.60 in the previous session.  Meta has separately struck a deal with AMD's larger rival Nvidia  to buy millions of AI chips.

content.title: AMD clinches second mega chip supply deal, this time with Meta
content.summary: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase ‌as much as 10% of the chip firm.  AMD shares rose more than 11% in premarket trading after closing at $196.60 in the previous session.  Meta has separately struck a deal with AMD's larger rival Nvidia  to buy millions of AI chips.

headline: AMD secures Meta as next big AI chip customer
summary: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase as much as 10% of the chip firm.  The company had signed a similar pact with ‌OpenAI last year, which was hailed as a vote of confidence in its chips and software, significantly boosting its stock price.

content.title: AMD secures Meta as next big AI chip customer
content.summary: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase as much as 10% of the chip firm.  The company had signed a similar pact with ‌OpenAI last year, which was hailed as a vote of confidence in its chips and software, significantly boosting its stock price.

headline: Sigma Doubles ARR in 12 Months as Markets Shift from Dashboards to AI-Powered Workflows
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 24, 2026--Sigma, a leader in AI applications for business, today announced preliminary business results for the fiscal year ending January 31, 2026, highlighting record momentum in revenue and customer adoption. Sigma achieved ARR growth of more than 100% year over year, driven by both new customer demand and expanding usage across existing enterprises.

content.title: Sigma Doubles ARR in 12 Months as Markets Shift from Dashboards to AI-Powered Workflows
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 24, 2026--Sigma, a leader in AI applications for business, today announced preliminary business results for the fiscal year ending January 31, 2026, highlighting record momentum in revenue and customer adoption. Sigma achieved ARR growth of more than 100% year over year, driven by both new customer demand and expanding usage across existing enterprises.

headline: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  News of the AMD deal comes just days after Meta announced a long-term partnership where it will use millions of chips and other equipment from Nvidia for its artificial-intelligence data centers.

content.title: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
content.summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  News of the AMD deal comes just days after Meta announced a long-term partnership where it will use millions of chips and other equipment from Nvidia for its artificial-intelligence data centers.

headline: US stocks hold steadier a day after slumping on AI worries
summary: The U.S. stock market is holding a bit steadier on Tuesday after getting a reminder that the artificial-intelligence technology boom may also have an upside.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 123 points, or 0.3%, as of 9:35 a.m. Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.2% lower.  Advanced Micro Devices helped lead the market and rose 6.8% after announcing a multi-year deal where it will supply chips to help power Meta Platforms’ AI ambitions.

Advanced Micro Devices helped lead the market and rose 6.8% after announcing a multi-year deal where it will supply chips to help power Meta Platforms’ AI ambitions.

headline: AMD CEO Says Meta Stock Deal Ties Company to a Market Leader
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Chief Executive Lisa Su said allowing Meta Platforms to buy as much as 10% of her company’s stock as part of a new partnership announced Tuesday is a “win-win from our shareholders' standpoint.”  The arrangement, which gives Meta warrants to buy up to 160 million AMD shares, ensures the chip maker will have a long-term partner with one of the leaders in AI development, she said in an interview with CNBC.  Meta has also agreed to buy 6 gigawatts’ worth of artificial intelligence computing power from AMD.

content.title: AMD CEO Says Meta Stock Deal Ties Company to a Market Leader
content.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Chief Executive Lisa Su said allowing Meta Platforms to buy as much as 10% of her company’s stock as part of a new partnership announced Tuesday is a “win-win from our shareholders' standpoint.”  The arrangement, which gives Meta warrants to buy up to 160 million AMD shares, ensures the chip maker will have a long-term partner with one of the leaders in AI development, she said in an interview with CNBC.  Meta has also agreed to buy 6 gigawatts’ worth of artificial intelligence computing power from AMD.

headline: Nvidia Wavers After AMD Partnership News Ahead Of Earnings; Is Nvidia A Buy Now?
summary: Nvidia shares rose slightly Tuesday, a day before the company's scheduled earnings report.  Is Nvidia stock a buy or sell now?  The multiyear deal is valued at more than $100 billion, according to The Wall Street Journal.

headline: Stocks Head Higher as Market Attempts a Rebound
summary: Stocks, like many on Wall Street, were on the move after they shoveled their way out early on Tuesday. The Dow rose 400 points, or 0.8%. The S&P 500 rose 0.5%. The Nasdaq Composite was up 0.7%. Leading the charge in the Dow were some of the stocks hit hard by yesterday’s selloff including International Business Machines, and Salesforce.

The deal could result in Meta owning as much as 10% of AMD’s stock, as the chip designer seeks to challenge Nvidia.

headline: Stocks Waver at the Open Following Another AI-Fueled Selloff
summary: Stocks were mixed on Tuesday as Wall Street sorted through the prior session’s selloff on artificial intelligence fears.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 0.1%.  Wall Street’s recent panic that success for AI upstarts could usurp leaders in various industries including software, logistics, and financial services reemerged on Monday when a blog by Citrini Research on Substack went viral among traders.

headline: US stocks stop their slide after seeing potential upsides from AI
summary: The U.S. stock market is rising on Tuesday after getting a reminder that the artificial-intelligence technology boom may also have an upside.  The S&P 500 rose 0.6%, a day after dropping 1%.  Under the agreement, Meta also got the right to buy up to 160 million shares of AMD stock for 1 cent each, depending in part on how many chips Meta ultimately buys.

Advanced Micro Devices popped on the stock market today after the company entered into a chip deal with Meta Platforms, while an electronics name soared to a new high after an upbeat earnings report.  The Dow progressed 0.9% as it inched back above its 50-day moving average.

headline: Meta to Spend Billions of Dollars on AMD Gear, Buy Stock
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. will deploy 6 gigawatts' worth of data center gear based on processors from Advanced Micro Devices Inc., a blockbuster deal that marks a win for the chipmaker's attempts to catch up with Nvidia Corp. Meta will buy AMD chips and computers designed to run artificial intelligence models over a five-year stretch, beginning in the second half of 2026. The series of transactions will be worth "double-digit billions" of dollars per gigawatt, according to AMD Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu.

content.title: Meta to Spend Billions of Dollars on AMD Gear, Buy Stock
content.description:
Meta Platforms Inc. will deploy 6 gigawatts' worth of data center gear based on processors from Advanced Micro Devices Inc., a blockbuster deal that marks a win for the chipmaker's attempts to catch up with Nvidia Corp.
Meta will buy AMD chips and computers designed to run artificial intelligence models over a five-year stretch, beginning in the second half of 2026. The series of transactions will be worth "double-digit billions" of dollars per gigawatt, according to AMD Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu.
content.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. will deploy 6 gigawatts' worth of data center gear based on processors from Advanced Micro Devices Inc., a blockbuster deal that marks a win for the chipmaker's attempts to catch up with Nvidia Corp. Meta will buy AMD chips and computers designed to run artificial intelligence models over a five-year stretch, beginning in the second half of 2026. The series of transactions will be worth "double-digit billions" of dollars per gigawatt, according to AMD Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu.

headline: AMD Meta AI Chip Pact Reframes Growth Potential And Valuation Debate
summary: AMD, ticker NasdaqGS:AMD, and Meta Platforms announced a multi year partnership for large scale AI infrastructure. Meta plans to purchase up to 6 gigawatts of AMD AI chips under the agreement. The deal includes a performance based stock warrant that could give Meta up to a 10% ownership stake in AMD. AMD is best known for its CPUs and GPUs in PCs, gaming, and servers. In recent years it has been building out a portfolio of data center and AI focused chips. The new agreement with Meta places...
